Description: Ambulance service codes billed by non-Ambulance Supplier. Only certified Ambulance Suppliers are eligible for reimbursement.
Modifiers: N/A - Edit based on provider type not modifiers
Denial_Conditions: PROVIDER_TYPE â‰  AMBULANCE_SUPPLIER, CODE in range A0021/A0225-A0999
Detection_Logic: Check provider specialty/taxonomy code. If not Ambulance Supplier and claim contains ambulance codes deny claim.
Example_Claim: CLM-001: Emergency Medicine NPI + A0427 DENIED; CLM-002: Ambulance Supplier + A0427 PAID

Description: Ambulance transportation code billed without required two-digit origin/destination modifier.
Modifiers: REQUIRED: Valid two-digit O/D combination (RH, SH, NH, HH, etc.)
Denial_Conditions: CODE in Ambulance Transportation list, MODIFIER is NULL or NOT in valid combination list
Detection_Logic: If ambulance transport code AND modifier field empty or not valid two-character O/D modifier deny claim.
Example_Claim: CLM-004: A0427 no modifier DENIED; CLM-005: A0427 + RH PAID

Description: Modifier X (intermediate stop at physician office) used in first position. X must only appear in second position.
Modifiers: INVALID: XD XE XG XH XI XJ XN XP XR XS XX; VALID: RX SX HX NX PX etc.
Detection_Logic: Parse two-digit modifier. If first character is X deny claim. X only valid as destination (second position).
Example_Claim: CLM-008: A0428 + XH DENIED; CLM-009: A0428 + RX PAID

Description: Service included in ambulance base rate billed separately. Oxygen drugs supplies EKG equipment are bundled.
Denial_Conditions: SAME_DOS, SAME_PROVIDER, AMBULANCE_CODE + BUNDLED_CODE on same claim
Detection_Logic: If ambulance transport code AND separately billed oxygen/drugs/supplies/EKG on same DOS deny bundled codes.
Example_Claim: CLM-012: A0427 PAID + E0424 DENIED + 93010 DENIED

Description: Ambulance transport between facilities during inpatient stay is not separately reimbursable. Excludes admit and discharge dates.
CPT_HCPCS_Codes: All ambulance codes with modifiers HH DH HD
Modifiers: HH (Hospital to Hospital), DH (Diagnostic to Hospital), HD (Hospital to Diagnostic)
Denial_Conditions: MODIFIER in (HH DH HD), DOS > ADMIT_DATE, DOS < DISCHARGE_DATE, PATIENT_STATUS = INPATIENT
Detection_Logic: If modifier HH/DH/HD AND DOS between admit and discharge dates (exclusive) deny claim. Facility responsible for transport.
Example_Claim: CLM-014: Admit 01/15 DOS 01/17 Discharge 01/20 + HD DENIED; CLM-015: DOS=Admit date PAID

Description: ALS Level 2 (A0433) billed without documentation of 3+ IV medications (excluding crystalloid) OR one ALS2 procedure.
Other_Codes_ICD: ALS2 Procedures: Defibrillation Intubation Central venous line Cardiac pacing Chest decompression Surgical airway Intraosseous line
Denial_Conditions: CODE = A0433, DOCUMENTATION does NOT show 3+ IV meds (excl crystalloid) OR ALS2 procedure
Detection_Logic: If A0433 billed verify documentation shows 3+ IV meds OR ALS2 procedure. If not downcode to A0427 or deny.
Example_Claim: CLM-017: A0433 + 2 IV meds DENIED; CLM-018: A0433 + Intubation PAID

Description: ALS Level 1 (A0426/A0427) billed without documentation of ALS assessment or ALS intervention.
Denial_Conditions: CODE in (A0426 A0427), DOCUMENTATION does NOT show ALS assessment or intervention
Detection_Logic: If ALS1 code billed verify documentation shows ALS assessment or intervention. If not downcode to BLS (A0428/A0429).
Example_Claim: CLM-022: A0427 + no interventions DENIED; CLM-023: A0427 + IV started PAID

Description: Multiple ambulance transports billed for same patient same date with same/overlapping origin/destination.
Modifiers: Same origin/destination modifier on multiple claims
Detection_Logic: If multiple transport codes same patient same date same supplier same modifier deny duplicate. Allow if docs support multiple trips.
Example_Claim: CLM-024: RH + A0429 PAID; CLM-025: RH + A0429 same DOS DENIED

Description: Provider bills ALS2 or ALS1 when actual service provided was BLS level.
Detection_Logic: Bill highest-reimbursement ALS2 code for routine transports. Falsify documentation to show interventions not performed.
Example_Claim: CLM-F1: BLS transport billed as A0433 with false intubation documentation

Description: Provider falsifies origin or destination to bill for longer mileage or avoid inpatient overlap denial.
Modifiers: Using S when pickup was scheduled; Using R when pickup was from facility; Avoiding HH/HD during inpatient
Detection_Logic: Falsify origin as Scene to bill as emergency. Change facility pickup to Residence to avoid institutional rules. Bill excessive mileage.
Example_Claim: CLM-F3: SNF to Hospital billed as SH instead of NH; CLM-F4: Inpatient transport billed as RH instead of HH

Description: Provider separately bills oxygen drugs supplies EKG that are included in ambulance base rate.
Other_Codes_ICD: Any supply drug or equipment codes
Detection_Logic: Bill ambulance transport base code then separately bill every supply medication and equipment used during transport.
Example_Claim: CLM-F5: A0427 + E0424 + J0170 + A4615 + 93010 all billed separately

Description: Non-ambulance entity bills ambulance codes by falsely registering as Ambulance Supplier or using ambulance NPI.
Detection_Logic: Hospital physician group or other entity bills ambulance codes using affiliated ambulance service NPI/TIN without providing transport. Shell company billing.
Example_Claim: CLM-F6: ER Physician group billing A0427; CLM-F7: Shell company billing A0429 no transport

Description: Provider manipulates modifiers to conceal that transport occurred during inpatient stay avoiding AMB-INPT denial.
Modifiers: Using RH instead of HH; Using NH instead of HH; Falsifying origin/destination
Detection_Logic: When patient is inpatient and transported to another facility bill with RH or other modifier instead of HD/DH/HH to avoid inpatient overlap edit.
Example_Claim: CLM-F8: Inpatient Day 3 Hospital to MRI billed as RD; CLM-F9: Inpatient Day 5 billed as NJ

Description: Provider bills emergency transport with S (scene) origin when transport was scheduled or non-emergency.
Detection_Logic: Bill scheduled dialysis or nursing home transports as scene calls (emergency) to receive higher emergency rate reimbursement.
Example_Claim: CLM-F10: Scheduled dialysis billed A0427+SH instead of A0426+RJ; CLM-F11: NH visit billed A0429+SH instead of A0428+NP

Description: Provider bills excessive mileage that does not match actual point-to-point distance.
CPT_HCPCS_Codes: A0380 (BLS mileage), A0390 (ALS mileage), A0425 (ground mileage)
Detection_Logic: Bill mileage significantly higher than actual distance. Claim detours or traffic routes to justify inflated mileage. Pattern: 2-3x actual distance.
Example_Claim: CLM-F12: 8 actual miles billed as 24 miles; CLM-F13: 5 actual miles billed as 15 miles

Description: Provider bills same transport multiple times or bills both transporting company and backup ambulance.
Detection_Logic: Submit same claim multiple times. Bill for ambulance that responded but did not transport. Bill round trips as two separate one-way transports.
Example_Claim: CLM-F14A: Ambulance A transported PAID; CLM-F14B: Ambulance B only responded DENIED
